comment:
Variables:
- \( x \): number of patients whose temperature is taken by the electronic thermometer
- \( y \): number of patients whose temperature is taken by the regular thermometer

Constants:
- \( t_{electronic} = 3 \): time in minutes taken by the electronic thermometer to make a reading
- \( t_{regular} = 2 \): time in minutes taken by the regular thermometer to make a reading
- \( \text{cooldown} = 50 \): minimum number of patients that should have their temperature checked by a regular thermometer
- \( \text{total\_time} = 15000 \): total time in minutes the office is open

Constraints:
1. \( x \geq 2y \): at least twice as many patients should have their temperature checked by the electronic thermometer than the regular thermometer
2. \( y \geq \text{cooldown} \): at least 50 patients should have their temperature checked by a regular thermometer
3. \( 3x + 2y \leq \text{total\_time} \): total time taken by both thermometers should not exceed the total time the office is open

Objective:
Maximize \( x + y \): maximize the number of patients whose temperature can be taken
